snippet: A Filipino group seeks to recapture Malaysian territory once belonging to the Sultanate of Sulu.
abstract: Agbimuddin Kiram, leader of band of armed Filipinos seeking to revive historical territorial claim on eastern Malaysian island of Borneo, says his group is evading Malaysian forces and trying to observe unilateral cease-fire, but will not surrender; commander’s statements, as well as Malaysia’s demands for unconditional surrender, suggest that conflict is far from over and could continue to strain relations between Malaysia and Philippines.
lead_paragraph: A Filipino group seeks to recapture Malaysian territory once belonging to the Sultanate of Sulu.

headline.main: Conflict in Northern Borneo Seems Poised to Escalate
headline.print_headline: Land Conflict in Northern Borneo Seems Poised to Escalate

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
